summary:
Currently I perform as Market Development Manager WASH for SNV. Netherlands Development Organisation, a global premium not for profit organisation with large projects in the sectors of WASH, Agriculture and Energy in more than 26 low and middle-income countries.

Previously during the last 15 years I have been engaged in the planning and implementation of internationalization strategies having worked for Businesses Asociations (UNEX), International Trade & Foreign Investment Promotion Agencies (PromoMadrid), Small and Medium Size Enterprises (Sociedad Española de Tratamiento del Agua-Grupo SETA) and Global Corporations (ACE/AECOM). 

This experience allows me to have a broad understanding of the Business Development and Project Management cycle with different clients and sectors in multicultural contexts. The management of teams of colleagues and international Experts has been a continuous feature during my career.

Since 2009 I have devoted my professional practice to the sectors of Infrastructure/ Environment and International Development having been involved in the procurement, award, kick-off and implementation of both capital investment projects and large Technical Assistance projects financed by the European Union and other International Donors.

Beyond the rewarding experience of working in a multitude of countries in several continents and having the opportunity to collaborate with a wide range of global professionals some specific achievements during these 15 years have been: 

1.The successfull setup of SETA in Mexico with contracts worth more than 4 Mill. EUR (clients: Abengoa, Nestlé, Fundación FEMSA)

2. The successful setup and development of the Water/Infrastructure Unit of ACE/AECOM with the award of several Technical Assistance projects worth in overall more than 8 Mill. USD. These projects are financed by different International Donors such as Millennium Challenge Corporation (USA), AECID/IADB or the Saudi Government.

projects.title: WATER END USE STUDY FOR THE KINGDOM OF SAUDI ARABIA
projects.description:
Client: ECRA (Electricity and Co-generation Authority); Budget: 1,707,670 USD

The main objective of the study is to determine Water End-Use for various customer categories in Saudi Arabia. The Study is expected to deliver the following objectives:

•	Consumption patterns and trends across the Kingdoms various clusters. 
•	Contribution of various appliances to total water use, the relative split between indoor and   
        outdoor use and/or seasonal and geographical variations in consumption
•	Identifying variations used for each appliance according to a variety of factors. 
•	Developing predictive models to forecast water demand.

projects.title: Institutional Strengthening for the De-concentration of the Water and Sewer Services Management of INAPA
projects.description:
INAPA-BID-AECID Project. Budget: 1.050.800 USD

The main objective of the consultancy is to provide technical assistance to design, develop and implement a business model in INAPA towards integrated management of water services and sanitation, with the following criteria: unity, quality, effectiveness and efficiency, allowing the development of INAPA in all its processes and decentralize the provision of water services and sanitation of the seven provinces of the program to four regional offices of INAPA.

projects.title: National Institutions Technical Assistance (WASH) CAPE VERDE
projects.description:
Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) founded project. Budget: 7.088.850 USD

The objective of the assignment is to provide the necessary technical assistance to WASH national level institutions, new and existing, in order to assist the setup and operation of a new regulatory and policy and planning regime for the WASH (Water, Sanitation and Hygiene) sector. 

The main activities of the project are the provision of Capacity building and structured training to facilitate starting up of ANAS (National Agency for Water and Sanitation) and assisting DGA (General Directorate of the Environment) and ARE (Economic Regulatory Agency) to understand and prepare for their roles in WASH in accordance with National reform objectives.

profile_positions.description:
Supporting companies and organizations to access new markets and explore the opportunities with International Financial Institutions (EU, IADB, WB, ADB, MCC, AFD,AECID, etc..). Specialization on Water & Sanitation Sector. Some activities:

1. Offering of session on access to Multilateral Markets in “Universidad Francisco de Vitoria – Master Degree on Strategic Management and International Trade”

2. In-company training for access to External Aid Instrument EU to “Centro Europeo de Empresas e Innovación de Albacete”
profile_positions.title: Head of Multilateral Unit

profile_positions.description:
In July 2014 ACE International Consultants was incorporated to the Forbes 500 Company AECOM (www.aecom.com) within the International Development Business Line of the Corporation (www.aecom.com/solutions/international-development/).

I became Head of the Infrastructure Unit in charge of the Business Development of the following sectors:

1. Water & Sanitation
2. Climate Change
3. Energy 
4. Transport

My responsibilities cover the management of the Business Development Cycle for large Technical Assistance Projects financed mainly by the European Commission (DG DEVCO-EuropeAid and other DGs) and other European Bilateral Donors (GIZ, AECID, AFD). Nevertheless I also managed in this period the award of the Project "Water End Use Study for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia", financed by the Saudi Government and during a brief period of time the team under my responsibility also addressed the requests for services of the Lot 6 (Environment) BENEF 2013.

I manage a team of 7 Project Managers (from Senior Project Managers to Interns) covering the entire Business Cylce with the European Commision (entailing a deep knowledge of the PRAG and Programme Estimate regulations). Besides I am in charge of the relation of the Unit with the rest of the AECOM network of offices in order to: 

1. Mobilise the resources of the Corporation of behalf of our pursuits (references, in-house expertise, local offices support, etc..). 

2. Fullfil all the compliance requirements of a large Corporation such as AECOM (budget approvals at different corporate level,compliance with the risk management policies, etc..)

This liaison role allows me to have a broad understanding of the internal procedures of global corporations and to establish fruitfull cooperation synergies with colleagues worldwide (UK, France, South Africa, USA, Latam, Australia, Hong Kong), in addition to enjoy of a multicultural working envionment.
profile_positions.title: Head of Infrastructure AECOM IDEV Europe

profile_positions.description:
In 2013 ACE International Consultants S.L. decided to diversify its scope of activities to the sector of Water & Sanitation

I incorporated to ACE as the Head of the newly created Water & Sanitation Unit in charge of the management of the entire business development cycle with Multilateral and Bilateral Donors (EuropeAid, WB, IADB, AECID, MCC, GIZ, AFD, etc.)

I was in charge of the definition of the strategic approach of the Unit, the identification of opportunities, the definition of the consortium strategy, the follow-up of the procurement stages (Forecast, Expression of Interest and Tender preparation and submission) and the signature of the Contracts once the projects were awarded.

From 2013 to 2014 the Unit at my charge was awarded with several Contracts: 

1. National Institutions Technical Assistance (WASH) Cape Verde (funded by the MCC)

2. Institutional Strengthening for the De-concentration of the Water and Sewer Services Management of INAPA,Dominican Republic (financed by AECID and IADB) 

As a result of the successful award of these projects the Unit grew from the initial 2 staff (Head of Unit plus Junior Project Manager) to a team of 7 Project Managers and extented its responsibilities beyond the business development to the actual implementation of the awarded projects. I was in charge then both of the teams of  Business Development and Project Implementation for the Water & Sanitation sector within ACE.

The scope of our projects is related with the "soft component" of the Water & Sanitation sector focusing our expertise on the provision of services of Capacity Building, Institutional Strengthening, Organisational Development for National Water Authorities and Utilities, definition of regulatory frameworks and support to the definition of water policies than enhance the coverture and quality of the water and sanitation services and provide an enabling environment for a sustainable management of water resources.
profile_positions.title: Head of Water & Sanitation Unit

company.name: Sociedad Española de Tratamiento de Aguas

profile_positions.description:
In 2009 Grupo SETA (Sociedad Española de Tratamiento de Aguas) a Spanish company with more than 40 years of experience in water supply and wastewater treatment plants decided to set up a subsidiary in Mexico.

I was in charge of the commercial expansion of its porfolio of products in Mexico. Grupo SETA has wide experience in the design, production and development of turnkey projects in the fields of desalination, water purification and emergency plants for water treatment.

Due to my experience in the field of International Trade and Investments my work entailed the identification and design of financial structures to foster the good end of the water treatment projects where the SETA Mexico took part. Project Finance, leasing plans or the relation with ECAs (Export Credits Agenies) were basis concepts for my daily work, additional to the relation with potential public and private clients and the coordination of resources with the Headquarters in Spain.

During my tenure the company was awarded with turnkey contracts worth more than 4 Mill.EUR for  diverse clients such as: Nestlé (ultrafiltration plant for whey processing), Abengoa (Reverse Osmosis Plants for a combined cycle gas turbine plant for Comision Federal de Electricidad de México) and Fundación FEMSA - Coca Cola (supply of emergency water supply plants donated to the Government of Tasbaco).
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager Grupo SETA México

profile_positions.description:
My responsibility was to identify and establish cooperation with foreign companies that can have the potential to invest in the Region of Madrid in order to understand their businesses and provide customized services from the initial stages of investment due diligence to the final establishment in Madrid Region

I also gave support to the different sectorial Project Managers in the preparation of investment events in Spain and abroad.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Manager

profile_positions.description:
I was the foreign trade advisor of Promomadrid - CEIM in Mexico. PromoMadrid was the Agency of export promotion of the Madrid Region (Spain). Promomadrid - CEIM was a project between the Goverment of the Madrid Region and the main bussines association of the region.

As part of the Agreement between the Madrid Regional Government and Mexican Federal Administration I was located within the premises of the Mexican Economy Secretary (equivalent to a Ministry in Spain).

My duties in Mexico encompassed the following activities: 1) Organize Matchmaking meetings between spanish and mexican companies, 2) Organize the presence of spanish companies in Trade Exhibitions in Mexico, 3) Consultancy on legal, commercial and fiscal issues for spanish companies willing to export or invest in Mexico,4) Market Research of Mexico strategic sectors for spanish companies, 5) Follow-up and reporting of the general performance of the Mexican economy and 6) Liasion with the other Spanish export and investment promotion Agencies with presence in the country (OFECOME, and other regional Agencies) on behalf of a fruitfull cooperation 7) Liaison with Mexican counterparts (businesses associations, Federal and State level Agencies, large mexican corporations).
profile_positions.title: FOREIGN TRADE ADVISOR

profile_positions.description:
Experimenta is a Magazine specialized in graphic, industrial an furniture design. Each two months we came out "Experimenta Magazine" which is the leader magazine of the sector in Spain. Our readers were  designers, architects, and marketing professionals. We also published differents Guides of Who is Who in the field of design in Spain.

As distribution manager of the company I was in charge three areas: 1) Suscription programs: I have to appeal new suscribers and manage the relation with the existing suscribers, 2) Distribution process: I had to manage all the process from the print to the bookstore, commercial relation with big bookstores networks, etc.. 3) External promotion: The same work that I had to do in the spanish market but in the international one, we sent the magazine to more than ten foreign countries. As part of my task abroad I had to organize the participation of the magazine in differents trade shows in Spain,  Sweden or Italy.
profile_positions.title: DISTRIBUTION MANAGER

profile_positions.description:
UNEX is the association of exporters of furniture from the center of Spain. I worked here as foriegn trade advisor helping spanish companies to improve their exports forign markets

I darfted market research studies about the commercial opportunities for the spanish companies of furniture in countries of center Europe, I also helped the Director General of the association in his relation with goverments and other associations and took part in the organization of Trade Shows and courses of foreign trade for the associated companies.
profile_positions.title: FOREIGN TRADE ADVISOR
